meanings.definition: To read (copy or proof) in order to find errors and mark corrections.
meanings.sent1: I proofread my essay to fix any mistakes.
meanings.sent2: She proofreads all her emails before sending them.
meanings.sent3: The detective had to proofread the ransom note for clues.
meanings.sent4: His attention to detail when he proofreads is like a magnifying glass on a tiny bug.
meanings.sent5: Remember to proofread your work carefully to avoid errors.

meanings.definition: To read and mark corrections on (printer's proofs, copy, etc.).
meanings.sent1: The editor will proofread the final draft before printing.
meanings.sent2: They proofread the brochure for any typos.
meanings.sent3: The teacher had to proofread the test papers before grading them.
meanings.sent4: Her red pen danced across the page as she proofread the document.
meanings.sent5: It is important to proofread important documents to ensure accuracy.

meanings.definition: To read and mark corrections in (something that has been written or printed).
meanings.sent1: I need to proofread this contract before signing it.
meanings.sent2: The author proofread the manuscript before sending it to the publisher.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that he needed to proofread his jokes before the show.
meanings.sent4: She carefully proofread the recipe to make sure it was perfect.
meanings.sent5: Before submitting your work, always remember to proofread for errors.
